name: autocomplete_places
description:
This is a sub-function API for tool spott.
Tool description: Search cities, countries and administrative divisions by name, autocompletion or IP.
API description: Returns a list of places that match a given prefix and specified filter properties, useful for creating "search as you type" inputs.

limit.description: Maximum number of places to return. Used together with \"skip\" to paginate results. Defaults to 10, maximum is 100.

skip.description: Amount of places to ignore before beginning to return results. Used together with \"limit\" to paginate results. Defaults to 0.

language.description: Specifies a language (ISO 639-1) to get the localized name of the place. If translation is not available, \"localizedName\" property will be null.

country.description: Filters places by their country \"id\". It's possible to specify multiple values separating them with commas (Ex. ?country=US,CA,MX).

admindivision1.description: Filters places by their adminDivision1 \"id\". It's possible to specify multiple values separating them with commas (Ex. ?country=US.CA,US.DE).

accuracyradiuskm.description: Maximum radius from the point specified by \"latitude\" and \"longitude\" to filter places located within the area. The value must be expressed in Kilometers. Defaults to 100km.

latitude.description: Latitude component of a coordinates set to filter places by their location. This parameter is ignored if \"longitude\" is not specified.

admindivision2.description: Filters places by their adminDivision2 \"id\". It's possible to specify multiple values separating them with commas.

q.description: Query string to find places whose names start with this prefix. Defaults to 'Sea'.

longitude.description: Longitude component of a coordinates set to filter places by their location. This parameter is ignored if \"latitude\" is not specified.

type.description: Filters places by their type. Multiple values can be specified, separated by commas. Valid types are 'CITY', 'ADMIN_DIVISION_1', 'ADMIN_DIVISION_2', and 'COUNTRY'. Defaults to 'CITY'.
